messages.message:
Hey, I'd love a demo button or setting that helps us show what Deployment Metrics would look like in production for customers. This is a key differentiator for us but is very hard to show without exposing customer data/solutions. I'd love to have a button that shows a mock-up of what all the graphs might realistically look like?

@jack.robbins
This is what I show atm which doesn't do it justice
cc: @Brian :eyes:
Interesting idea, would showing mockups on Figma work for this or does that not feel real enough for customers
I'd like it to be embedded in the product - if we had a deployment that was kept up to date that would work, but its really hard since the metrics have a temporal nature so change every day

The best solution to this may be having a deployment and having it run every few hours or day automatically via api. We have cypress tests (frontend end to end testing) that does this for certain deployments in the UAT environment and the metrics for that look more populated since its a run a lot
This would also be massively useful for many of our live Enablement sessions, as well as our video content & Scribe guides
+100000 having a stubby metrics page accessible in platform would be amazing.
@Udit how hard would it be to duplicate that cypress process but for a deployment in prod? Would that introduce any sort of risk to prod?

I wouldn't use cypress to do it. Just need to call an api that runs the deployment of choice periodically. I think a solution engineer would be able to do this quite easily.  Could use github actions to do this too through a cron job. I don't think there is a risk unless we call it too many times which slows down the environment. Something like once every 4 hours should not though.
Can we just use an upstream integration then?
oh yah :sweat_smile: this is easily solvable via an upstream integration

see docs for it here: https://docs.instabase.com/apps/run-and-deploy#configuring-integrations

essentially setup the documents you want processed on a drive and then setup a schedule for running the deployment using documents from the drive folder @Hamish
Note: this will start to fill up automation metrics, however it will not fill up any review metrics since those require actually reviewing and correcting fields in documents.

@Hamish in the next release there will also be a toggle for keeping processed files in the folder after processing, so basically it will keep running the same files on a schedule. This means you'd always have the same results for each run (theoretically lol). You could always occasionally switch up the documents.
Is there a dedicated drive folder we can allocate for the upstream integration? AFAIK, if we connect our existing G Drives, all content is accessible (and not just specified sub-folders)

> Note: this will start to fill up automation metrics, however it will not fill up any review metrics since those require actually reviewing and correcting fields in documents.
This is equally, if not more important to have IMO :lil_nervous:
Upstream integrations don't actually work with google drive because we don't have write permission to them

Oh yeah, oops :slightly_smiling_face:

I suppose then if we have some S3/Azure Cloud drives, that'd be great!

Thanks everyone I think upstream integrations is a good idea - that said I agree with Brian, the review metrics would be key. I’d prefer to have a static page with things like the bar charts of validated + correct etc

Doesn’t have to be real data or a real project, just something we can walk people through
I wonder if we can have a special query string we can add (`?demo=true)` ) to any metrics route, and it makes it so that the metrics endpoints return mock data instead @Liam Callanan @Udit
If we have any deployments with good metrics right now, we can just download the results of those endpoints and save them to use for the mock data

FWIW this is the dashboard I've been using: https://aihub.instabase.com/deployments/01922adb-aa87-7886-91b6-49e2d713ada2/metrics?asOfTime=1729470614190&interval=30_days (Product-Team workspace on prod). I changed the asOfTime parameter in the URL (milliseconds since epoch) to go back to October 20th.

The painful parts are that you need to upload files on a distributed schedule, and then continuously update it & perform reviews every few weeks since it's a rolling time window, or change the asOfTime in the URL. Even that link will only last for another 3 days...
